context: Drone swarms already exist. They have bombed Saudi oilfields in recent years. A hydrogen fuel cell has over 100 times the flight time of an equivalent battery. Replacing fuel charges would be quick and would not require a ground station readily blown to bits by any microwave guided drone. If the Army is funding this, then we are truly in trouble.

replies.context: Hi WhSmith.  This is interesting.   Do you have an source articles which could back up this conclusion?  Are there drones operating on H today???

Hydrogen UAV fuel cells exist, but they are most definitely a work in progress. Also, under current restraints, while 100s of times flight life does sound nice, current systems are only quadrupling flight life with best results.
